page.title: 02LOCAL PLACE NAMES
page.content: {Allendale}means "the valley of the white water." { {Hope}- a river valley which runs up to the fell.Examples are {Swinhope, {Highhope and Wellhope. {Shield}- a summer hut near the fell.Examples are {Knockshield and New {Shield. {Hall(ha)}- a house built on the top of a steep bank.Examples are {Broadwood {Hall and Stone Hall. {Park} - former hunting ground of Bishop of Durham.Examples are {Woolley {Park and Parkside. {Lea }- a meadow (Anglo-Saxon "leagh").Examples are {Heatherlea {and Hayleazes. {Gyll or Gill - }a steep narrow valley.Example {Gill House. {Peth -}a road on the steep sloping bank of a river. { }
